channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Is Generative AI The New Hero Of Your Consumer Products And Retail Business?
item.description: GenAI is being used in various ways in the consumer packaged goods (CPG) and retail industries, and not all of them are directly customer-facing.

item.title: Glib
item.description: One of the valid complaints about some AI systems is that they make stuff up, with confidence, and without sourcing, and then argue when challenged. U...

item.title: When Do New ‘Cobra Kai’ Season 6, Part 2 Episodes Come To Netflix?
item.description: Everything you need to know about Cobra Kai Season 6, Part 2 on Netflix now that Part 1 is streaming.

item.title: A branding exercise
item.description: My friend’s organization is working with a branding studio to think about how they appear to people who don’t know them well. This is sometimes called...

item.title: ‘Escape From Tarkov’ PvE Mode Now Available To Everyone For $20
item.description: Anyone with any version of Escape From Tarkov can now buy access to the PvE mode that was initially locked behind a $250 special edition.

item.title: Bullies
item.description: Bullies use intimidation and power to force others to act against their best interests. Bullies blame the victim, assuring everyone that they wouldn’t...

item.title: Why AMD Spent $665 Million Buying A Tiny AI Research Team
item.description: The chip giant hopes that Silo AI's 300-strong team of researchers from Finland can help it compete with Nvidia’s Cuda platform, the gold standard for...

item.title: The page-a-day calendar
item.description: Time passes. And humans have always kept track. Distribution and technology combined to create a few decades where the tear off daily calendar was nea...

item.title: The Executive Playbook For Generative AI: Turning Potential Into Business Value
item.description: Those hoping that GenAI offers a shortcut past the tough—and necessary—detailed analysis of business outputs will likely yield disappointing results.
